page.title: 10ECONOMICS
page.content:
Living in the country has become more and more expensive over the past few years.With the increase in oil in the 70s petrol prices have increased and road tax per year is now Â£100 each car.Public transport has been axed and there is now no village bus through Cadeleigh.We are very lucky in that we still have our sub_postoffice and telephone kiosk and there have been fears that these will go ,leaving the old people in a difficult situation.In years to come it may be a sad fact of life that country living will be solely for the rich and healthy.
Compiled by Tom Bell Heather Keeble Margaret Noon Jan Thom
